(Simplified: 绛)
Pictophonetic: 夅 indicates the sound; 糹 (silk) conveys the meaning.
Freq: 9448
Hanzi: 绛

绛，jiàng，汉字，简体部首：纟，部外笔画：6，总笔画：9。
形声字，从糸（mì）， 声， 为“降”声。本义为大红色，《说文》，“绛，大赤也”。《释名》，“绛，工也，然之难得色，以得色为工”，大红难染，染成者即为巧工。”亦有绛草，植物，也称紫草，可做染料，《尔雅》，“绛，绛草，出临贺郡，可以染食”。
一种颜色，即大红色；地名，春秋时代晋国都城。
Jiang, jiàng, Chinese characters, simplified radicals: 纟, external strokes: 6, total strokes: 9.
The pictophonetic character, from 糸 (mì), the sound, is the "falling" sound. The original meaning is big red, "Shu Wen", "Crimson, Da Chi also". "Shi Ming", "Crimson, work, but it is rare to get color, to get color for work", red is difficult to dye, and the one who dyes it is skillful. "Crimson grass, also known as comfrey, can be used as a dye, "Er Ya", "Crimson, Crimson grass, out of Linhe County, can be dyed and eaten."
A kind of color, namely big red; place name, the capital of Jin State in the Spring and Autumn Period.

絳字的基本解释

絳
jiàng
见“绛”。

絳字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jiàng］
［《廣韻》古巷切，去絳，見。］
“绛1”的繁体字。
(1)深红色。
(2)染为绛色。
(3)草名。可以染红。
(4)古地名。春秋晋国旧都。在今山西省翼城县东南。晋穆侯自曲沃迁都于此，孝公时改名为翼。及景公迁新田，称为新绛，遂称此为故绛。
(5)古地名。晋都。今山西省侯马市。晋景公迁都至新田，改名新绛。后即称为绛。汉为绛县。

絳字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　絳； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页924第04
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?古巷切，音降。【說文】大赤也。【釋名】絳，工也。染之難得色，以得色爲工也。【急就篇註】絳，古謂之纁。【左思·吳都賦】綸組紫絳。【註】絳，絳草也。出臨賀郡，可以染。　又地名。【左傳·莊二十六年】士蔿城絳。【註】絳，晉所都也，今平陽絳邑縣。　又水名。【史記·魏世家】絳水可以灌平陽。【註】絳水，源出絳山。

絳字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

Crimson
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jiàng］
["Guangyun" ancient alley cut, go to Jiang, see you. ]
Traditional characters for "绛1".
(1) Crimson.
(2) Stained in crimson.
(3) Cursive name. Can be dyed red.
(4) Ancient place names. The old capital of Jin country in the Spring and Autumn Period. In today's southeast of Yicheng County, Shanxi Province. Jin Muhou moved his capital here since Quwo, and changed his name to Yi when he was Xiao Gong. He Jinggong moved to Xintian and was called Xinjiang, so he called it Gujiang.
(5) Ancient place names. Jindu. Today, Houma City, Shanxi Province. Jinjinggong moved its capital to Xintian and changed its name to Xinjiang. Later it was called Jiang. Han is Jiangxian.
Crimson

It is rare to get color when dyed, and it is also a work to get color. [Anxious to the article note] Crimson, ancient known as the 纁. 【Zuo Si·Wu Du Fu】Lun group purple crimson. [Note] Crimson, Crimson grass also. You can dye it when you leave Linhe County.　Also place name. [Zuo Zhuan·Twenty-sixth Year of Zhuang] Shi Lin Cheng Jiang. 【Note】Jiang, the capital of Jinsuo, today Jiangyi County, Pingyang.　Also known as water. 【Historical Records·Wei Family】Crimson water can be used to irrigate Pingyang. [Note] Jiangshui originates from Jiangshan.
